sources.title: Crosby, Columbo, and Vallee (1932)
sources.description: Crosby, Columbo, and Vallee is a 1932 Warner Bros. Merrie Melodies cartoon short directed by Rudolf Ising. The short was released on March 19, 1932. It lampoons the popularity of crooners among young women, with popular crooners Bing Crosby, Russ Columbo, and Rudy Vallée being the namesake of the film. Watch on RetroFlix.org:  https://retroflix.org/crosby-columbo-and-vallee-1932/

metadata.Plot: As a tribe of Indians sings, the women are all falling for the three singers of the title, Bing Crosby, Russ Columbo, and Rudy Vallee. A brave brings a radio to his girlfriend, and she joins in the title song. The woodland animals join in, doing impersonations. While the tribe dances, a fire gets out of control. Three baby birds, trapped in a tree, are saved by a spider web used as a net.
